result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor A. Lacapa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Atty's argue plea agreement and the reference to expunction at plea hearing.  
COURT addressed the Attorney's as to expunction - will proceed in sentencing and will at the appropriate time ask about expunction as to this matter - objection by the state is over-ruled.  Victim notification complied with.

COURT:  Sentence fine/costs $705.00 given 30 days to pay or set up a payment plan - 60 days county jail to begin 6/1/16 by 3:00 pm with huber and good time

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Atty Poquette presents agreement: 60 days county jail and fine/costs totalling $705.   DA states victim notification has been completed.
Atty Moldenhauer makes statement regarding expungement, DA objects and states expungement is not a part of their agreement and he will withdraw the agreement and reestablish the charge as a felony if expungement is requested.  Atty Moldenhauer states he retracts the expungement comments as DE would like to proceed today, but Judge resets hearing to have time to check case law in regards to what establishes a breach of plea agreement and to consider if he needs to request substitution of Judge in this matter now that the expungement issue has been debated in this manner.   Parties may submit Briefs, but not required.
Adjourned sentencing hearing set for June 1, 2016  2:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend to 940.19(1) misd. battery.  Court grants motion to amend.  DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court finds defendant guilty.  State needs to contact the victim before proceeding to sentencing.  
Bond will continue.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:54 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Moldenhauer makes stmt - defendant is going to be trying to get into the service needs more time 60 days being requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Moldenhauer requests an adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. DEF stands mute. NG plea entered.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing 6-16-15.  Appearances:  District Attorney Bruce Poquette, Attorney Paul Moldenhauer, Defendant Victor Lacapa

Defendant Victor A. Lacapa in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.   Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Shaun Anderson LCO PD sworn and testifies.  Witness, Mr. Anderson, identifies defendant.  Officer Anderson steps down.  States moves for bind over.  Defense moves for dismissal.  Court grants motion for bind over.  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
